personal.name: Iesus Davila
personal.title: Robotics & AI Engineer
personal.bio: Ingeniero especializado en robótica e inteligencia artificial con una sólida formación académica y experiencia en investigación. Apasionado por el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras que combinen robótica avanzada con inteligencia artificial.

featured.title: Software Architecture Master-Slave
featured.description: Based on the use of UGVs and ROS2 Humble, applying software architecture techniques and robust design patterns. The results confirmed that, under the master-slave structure, the system completes all assigned tasks, even in case of failure of one or more robots.

featured.title: Multi Robot System
featured.description: Multi Robot System developed for ROS2 Humble, allows the easy incorporation of several robot models with little configuration. There is no limit on the number of robots, if you incorporate UGV you can provide your parameter file for autonomous navigation.

featured.title: AUV Max: Simulator for Autonomous Underwater Vehicles
featured.description: It focuses on the development of a submersible UAV, using advanced technologies in robotics, automatic control and machine vision. Developed with ROS2 Humble, Gazebo Garden 7 and Rviz2, this project represents a pioneering effort in the simulation and operation of autonomous underwater vehicles.

all.title: Follower Car
all.description: Follower algorithm for TurtleBot3 and ROVER using only 2D LIDAR and traditional control techniques. The algorithm can be run on N robots, achieving a chain of follower robots. No machine vision or anything similar is used in the algorithm.

all.title: KUKA Kr210 - Pick and Place
all.description: It uses ROS Noetic and MoveIt for motion planning and OpenCV for real-time object detection based on color segmentation. The system ensures accurate trajectory execution and seamless communication between perception and control, enabling efficient and autonomous pick and place operations.

featured.title: Software Architecture and Simulation Interface for Autonomous Underwater Vehicles
featured.description: It focuses on the development of a submersible UAV, using advanced technologies in robotics, automatic control and machine vision. Developed with ROS2 Humble, Gazebo Garden 7 and Rviz2, this project represents a pioneering effort in the simulation and operation of autonomous underwater vehicles.

experience.description: Development of Artificial Vision, LLM and trajectory planning algorithms for theexecution of functionalities.
Development of Machine Learning algorithms for process prediction in product manufacturing.
Development of a tracking robot using only a 2D LIDAR sensor, with speed control for precise object tracking.

featured.title: Best paper award in the track of Robotics and Automation
featured.description: Recognition for innovative contributions at the IEEE ETCM Ecuador conference, for the paper 'Software Architecture and Simulation Interface for Autonomous Underwater Vehicles'

prizes.title: Best paper award in the track of Robotics and Automation
prizes.description: Recognition for innovative contributions at the IEEE ETCM Ecuador conference, for the paper 'Software Architecture and Simulation Interface for Autonomous Underwater Vehicles'
